title: Heritage Fremantle Escape with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description: Discover the many charms of Fremantle with a stay at the historic Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges, a beautiful heritage hotel dating back to 1850. Perfectly positioned on the vibrant esplanade, this iconic property places you close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, home to atmospheric restaurants housed in Victorian façades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores.

title: Heritage Fremantle Escape with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover the endless charms of Fremantle with a stylish stay at the Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges, a gorgeous heritage hotel dating back to 1850. Between exploring the gems of Fremantle's fun-filled streets, make use of the hotel's exceptional facilities: take a dip in one of the two swimming pools and soak in the Western Australian sunshine, be wined and dined in the Atrium Garden Restaurant or treat yourself to a classic pub feast and drink at Ball & Chain pub, featuring a sleek bourbon lounge.

Just 30 minutes from Perth, where the Swan River meets the Indian Ocean, this iconic property places you on the vibrant esplanade. Enviably close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, this hotel invites you to discover atmospheric restaurants housed in Victorian façades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores. An eclectic city blending historic charm with a dynamic arts scene, Fremantle boasts some of the best-preserved 19th-century port streetscape in the world. Fabulous artisanal food, a strong craft beer scene, great coffee and trendy boutiques are all at your doorstep, making it the perfect destination for a romantic break. Experience it all staying at the most iconic hotel in town, the historic Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges.
location_description: Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges Feb 22

title: Heritage Fremantle Escape with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover the many charms of Fremantle with a stay at the historic Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges, a beautiful heritage hotel dating back to 1850. Perfectly positioned on the vibrant esplanade, this iconic property places you close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, home to atmospheric restaurants housed in Victorian façades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores.

title: Fremantle Heritage Icon near South Terrace Cappuccino Strip with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover Fremantle's charm with a stylish stay at this heritage hotel dating back to 1850. Located on the esplanade close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, this hotel invites you to discover atmospheric restaurants behind Victorian facades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores.

Between outings on the cobblestoned streets, take time to relax in one of the two swimming pools or explore the four onsite dining options. Enjoy a buffet spread for breakfast at Atrium Garden Restaurant, soak in the sun with a cocktail in hand at The Poolside Bar, enjoy boutique brews in the beer garden of Ball & Chain or a nightcap at Marine Lounge Bar.

Just 25 minutes from Perth - where the Swan River meets the Indian Ocean - Fremantle is Western Australia’s favourite seaside escape, recently crowned the state’s Top Tourism Town at the 2025 Top Tourism Town Awards. This eclectic city blends historic port streetscapes with a vibrant arts scene, top-notch coffee, craft beer, artisanal food and stylish shopping - ideal for a romantic break.
offer_address: 46-54 Marine Terrace, Fremantle, Western Australia 6160, Australia

title: Heritage Fremantle Escape with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover the many charms of Fremantle with a stay at the Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges, a beautiful heritage hotel dating back to 1850. Between exploring the gems of Fremantle's fun-filled streets, make use of the hotel's fabulous facilities: take a dip in one of two swimming pools and soak in the Western Australian sunshine, be wined and dined in the Atrium Garden restaurant or treat yourself to a classic pub feast and drink at Ball & Chain pub, featuring a sleek bourbon lounge.

Just 30 minutes from Perth, where the Swan River meets the Indian Ocean, this iconic property places you on the vibrant esplanade. Enviably close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, this hotel invites you to discover atmospheric restaurants housed in Victorian façades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores. An eclectic city blending historic charm with a dynamic arts scene, Fremantle boasts some of the best-preserved 19th-century port streetscape in the world, fabulous artisanal food, a strong craft beer scene, great coffee and trendy boutiques - making it the perfect destination for a romantic break. Experience it all staying at the most iconic hotel in town, the historic Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges.

**Your handpicked inclusions:**

- Wake up to delicious daily buffet breakfast served at the Atrium Garden Restaurant
- At the end of each day, celebrate your indulgent city escape with one nightly drink per person with your choice of house wine or draught beer
- Get a taste for the region with a daily seasonal tasting plate of local produce to share
- Experience contemporary elegance with a complimentary upgrade to a Superior Pool View Room
- Relax right up until the last moment with guaranteed 12pm late checkout

**Spa Upgrade:** Elevate your stay when you upgrade to a King Spa Room, boasting a plush king bed and a spa bath to achieve ultimate relaxation.

**Rottnest Island Upgrade:** No trip to Fremantle is complete without visiting the smiling quokkas on the renowned Rottnest Island. When you upgrade to the King Spa Room with Rottnest Island Upgrade included, you'll enjoy return ferry transfers and bicycle hire to use across the island on one day of your stay.
offer_address: 46-54 Marine Terrace, Fremantle, Western Australia 6160, Australia

title: Historic Fremantle Esplanade Escape
description: Just 30 minutes from Perth, where the Swan River meets the Indian Ocean, the iconic Esplanade Hotel Fremantle by Rydges stands in all its 1850s splendour. Discover everything this boho harbour town has to offer with a stay at this grand heritage hotel, nestled on the esplanade close to the famed South Terrace ‘Cappuccino Strip’, home to atmospheric restaurants housed in Victorian facades, designer boutiques and vintage bookstores. Stay at this quintessential Fremantle icon and be perfectly placed to ferry to Rottnest Island, home to the friendly quokka, set sail on a Swan River cruise into cosmopolitan Perth and see Fremantle’s three famed sights: Fremantle Prison, the WA Shipwrecks Museum and WA Maritime Museum.
offer_address: 46-54 Marine Terrace, Fremantle, Western Australia 6160, Australia

title: Self-Contained Apartment Stay in Fremantle's West End
description: Discover the many charms of Fremantle with a stylish apartment stay at Quest Fremantle, perfectly positioned in the city’s historic West End. Pairing modern hotel-style facilities with the freedom of a self-contained apartment, this is a stylish home-away-from-home, where you can rest in complete comfort after long days exploring. Catch a short ferry to Rottnest Island and take a selfie with a cute native quokka, set sail on a Swan River cruise into Perth, and visit Fremantle Prison, the WA Shipwrecks Museum and WA Maritime Museum.

title: Stylish Fremantle Escape in Vibrant Richmond Quarter
description:
Uncover Fremantle's buzzing Richmond Quarter, a hub for arts, culture and gastronomy, when you stay at Seashells Fremantle, the ultimate launchpad to the city's best sights. Stylish rooms and self-contained apartments are located on the top two levels of the stunning new Richmond Quarter development, where shared facilities include a breezy European-style piazza and a rooftop restaurant and bar (perfect for enjoying a cocktail with views over the Swan River).

One of the major drawcards for a stay in this swanky setting is its close proximity to Fremantle's best sights. The vibrant bars and nightlife of North Fremantle are an easy stroll away, while sunkissed pathways winding along the Swan River are perfect for energising morning walks. Grab a bite to eat at Fremantle Market, and for a dose of history and culture, museums, galleries and historic sites (including the infamous Fremantle Prison) are within short driving distance.
